name: v51
body:
## What's Changed
* Updating Ruby 3.1 to use Clang by @lnguyen in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/259
* Fix Gemfile.lock by @ragaskar in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/257

## New Contributors
* @lnguyen made their first contribution in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/259
* @ragaskar made their first contribution in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/257

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/compare/v50...v51

name: v50
body:
## What's Changed
* #256 fixes #254, errors in an internetless environment caused by a missing gem.

## New Contributors
* @jpalermo made their first contribution in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/256

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/compare/v49...v50

name: v49
body:
Update to Ruby 3.1.2
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/compare/v48...v49

name: v48
body:
## What's Changed
* Fix broken offline environment create-env by @nouseforaname in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/251. The update to ruby 3.1 and the new version of bundler that came with it broke some of the bundler flags. This caused bundler to reach out to rubygems which caused failures in environments without internet access.

## New Contributors
* @nouseforaname made their first contribution in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/251

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/compare/v47...v48

name: v47
body:
## What's Changed
* fix property used for multi-homed vms detection by @o-orand in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/241
* Make agent credentials optional for accessing blobstore with signed URLs enabled by @bgandon in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/242
* add a cloud properties to manage VRRP port check. by @o-orand in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/243
* bump cpi to Ruby 3.1 by @ramonskie in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/245
* Bump fog-openstack to 1.1.0 to support Cinder v3 API by @yaguangtang in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/249

## New Contributors
* @o-orand made their first contribution in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/241
* @bgandon made their first contribution in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/242
* @ramonskie made their first contribution in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/245
* @yaguangtang made their first contribution in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/249

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/compare/v46...v47

name: v46
body:
## What's Changed
* Fix test description for a not even resize value by @beyhan in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/240
* Update to ruby-2.7 [fixes #238]

🔗  Improvements
- Added support for using OpenStack multiple domains when using the keystone v3 API https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/236. This change requires bosh director [271.9.0](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh/releases/tag/v271.9.0) or later. Thanks @andinod
- Bump [addressable to 2.8.0](https://github.com/sporkmonger/addressable/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#addressable-280) which fixes ReDoS vulnerability in Addressable::Template#match

name: v44
body:
This is just a maintenance release bumping dependencies

*Noteworthy bumps of dependencies:*
- ruby release `2.4.9-r0.27.0`
- netaddr `2.0.4`
- fog-openstack `1.0.10`
- excon `0.68.0`

name: v43
body:
This release does not bring new features, but some of the internals have changed:

- consume https://github.com/bosh-packages/ruby-release instead of providing its own ruby package
  - used ruby version: `2.4.6-r0.11.0`
- regular version bumps of used ruby gems

name: v42
body:
_New features_:
- Registry is now optionally used. The registry is bypassed when the director is version 268.3+, Xenial stemcell line 170.2+ or Cent OS stemcell line 3763.3+, and OpenStack CPI v42+.
- CPI adheres to API version 2. See https://bosh.io/docs/cpi-api-v2/ for more information

_Noteworthy bumps of dependencies_:
- fog-openstack 1.0.7
- bosh_cpi 2.5.0
- rubygems 2.7.8
- bundler 1.17.3

name: v41
body:
*Misc*
* Update to ruby 2.4.5
* Update to fog-openstack 1.0.6

name: v40
body:
*Breaking*
* [Remove support for auto-anti-affinity](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159522260)
  This has never been working properly as OpenStack uses a weight-based approach to soft-anti-affinity instead of a filter-based approach. We don't think anybody could have used this feature successfully, so we decided to remove it entirely. Let us know if you had been using this feature with the desired effect! If you had it enabled before, you need to manually remove the server groups created in your OpenStack. They are prefixed with the Director name and UUID, so they should be easy to identify.
* Remove support for Cinder v1 and Glance v1
  Those API versions have been deprecated for a few years now. It has become troublesome to get an OpenStack environment where we can test this functionality. We couldn't guarantee that this would be working in the future and therefore decided to remove it entirely. Let us know if you're still depending on Cinder v1 and/or Glance v1!

*Fixes*
* [Fix parsing OpenStack exception error messages](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159431340)
  The message `Error: Unknown CPI error 'Unknown' with message 'undefined method 'message' for #\u003cString:0x0000560c9a866e40\u003e' in 'delete_vm' CPI method` should be gone now

*New Features*
* [Re-use existing neutron ports if possible](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159498851)
  This fixes most of the `IP address in use` errors as e.g. reported in https://github.com/cloudfoundry/bosh/issues/1991
* [Automatically retry idempotent HTTP requests to OpenStack API](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157779658), fixes #131

*Misc*
* Bump to fog-openstack 1.0.5, fixes #130 
* Bump to libyaml 0.2.1
* Bump to ruby 2.4.4
* Bump to rubygems 2.7.7
* Bump to bundler 1.17.1

name: v39
body:
*Fixes*
* Fixes #126 by bumping fog-openstack. This CPI version should run fine on Huawei Fusion Sphere again.

*New Features*
* Allow specifying multiple OpenStack nova AZs for a single BOSH AZ (https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154906772)
  * CPI will create VMs randomly in one of the listed AZs and retry a different one if creation fails
  * Can be used to upgrade OpenStack hypervisors in bulk and take entire AZs down
  * Use a block like this to specify multiple OpenStack nova AZs in your cloud config
    ```
    azs:
    - name: z1
      cloud_properties:
        availability_zones: [nova-1, nova-2]
    ```
* Allow referencing security groups by CID as alternative to name (https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155258034)
* Much improved logging for debugging infrastructure issues 
  * We've cleaned up the CPI logs and removed a bunch of unnecessary information. If you feel we've done too much or too little here: [let us know](https://github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/issues) (https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/134167789)
  * Prefix all CPI logs with director request-id (https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155891841). This makes it easier to find all CPI calls to OpenStack which belong to the same director action.

*Misc*
* Improved error messages when VM and Disk are in different AZs (https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156221894)
* Improved error messages when auto-anti-affinity doesn't work due to insufficient quota (https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154796675)
* Removed gem files from repository and add `pre-packaging` script instead (https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156221464)
* Bumped `fog-openstack` to 0.1.26
* Bumped `fog-core` to 1.45.0
* Bumped `excon` to 0.62.0

name: v38
body:
*Fixes*
* Auto-anti-affinity: Avoid race conditions when [creating](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154630981) and [deleting](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154715473) server groups.

*Features*
* Auto-anti-affinity: [Delete server groups when the last VM of an instance group is deleted.](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154715473) No dangling server groups anymore! 

*Misc*
* Bump `fog-openstack` to `0.1.24` and remove fork. We're back to upstream now!
* Bump `multi_json` to 1.13.1
* Bump `public_suffix` to 3.0.2

name: v37
body:
*Breaking Changes*
  * Remove custom 'create light stemcell' script in favor of `bosh repack-stemcell` command

*Fixes*
  * `OpenStack compute binding only supports version v2 and v2.1.` is no longer shown although your OpenStack actually uses nova v2 and greater already

*Features*
  * vrrp support for created neutron ports via #98 (thanks @rkoster!)
    * Add `cloud_properties.allowed_address_pairs: <IP>` to have this IP address added to the network ports created in OpenStack Neutron. This way, you can use the haproxy release's [`keepalived` job](https://github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/haproxy-boshrelease/tree/master/jobs/keepalived) to add some HA to your haproxy!

*Misc*
  * Bump ruby to 2.4.3
  * Bump bundler to 1.16.1
  * Bump excon to 0.60.0

name: v36
body:
*Features*
* [auto-anti-affinity](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135846445)
    * When the global property `openstack.enable_auto_anti_affinity: true` is set, the CPI automatically creates nova server groups with the policy `soft-anti-affinity` and adds all members of an instance group to it. If possible, all VMs of an instance group are distributed across different hypervisors. This requires OpenStack Mitaka and higher.
* [User-defined metadata tags are applied to snapshots](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149845950)

*Misc*
* bumped bundler to 1.16.0
* bumped rubygems to 2.7.3
* bumped fog-openstack to 0.1.23.pre with support for nova microversions

name: v35
body:
*Fixes*
 * [Handle race condition during parallel LBaaSv2 API actions](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151122631). No more `HTTP 409 Conflict` errors, yay!

*Misc*
 * Update fog-openstack to 0.1.22 via #94 (thanks @wildloop)
   * Removes calls to the `.json` compatibility API for OpenStack nova, which should make the CPI run on OpenStack Pike!
 * Update rubygems to 2.6.14

name: v34
body:
*Fixes*
* [Make loadbalancer member deletion more resilient](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150740590)
  * Don't fail if loadbalancer pool, membership, or listener are deleted outside of BOSH

*New features*
* [Support `boot_from_volume` in `vm_types`/`resource_pools`](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150914981)
  * Can be used to override global `boot_from_volume` configuration per `vm_type`
* [Allow for security groups in `vm_extensions` and in `networks` simultaneously](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150133075)
  * Precedence: vm_extension > vm_type/resource_pool > network
* [Add metadata to disk snapshots](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149845950)

*Misc*
* Update ruby to 2.4.2
* Update rubgems to 2.6.13
* Update bundler to 1.15.4
* Update libyaml to 0.1.7

name: v33
body:
*Fixes*
 * [LBaaS: Wait until loadbalancer is out of state PENDING_UPDATE before the next action](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/147909383)
  * [LBaaS: Delete pool membership before deleting the VM.](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/148837971) No more ports hanging around after undeploying!
  * [LBaaS: Don't fail if pool membership doesn't exist.](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149493797) Manually removing things is ok now.

*New features*
 * [Support for OpenStack's native `resize disk` feature.](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140647137) Making your disks bigger now doesn't take forever anymore!
   * Works with bosh >= v263
   * Needs to be enabled with a global property
    ```
     director.enable_cpi_resize_disk: true
    ```

*Misc*
 * [Improved error message when quota exceeded](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/145152603)
 * [Remove no longer supported blobstore clients from code and documentation](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140855057)

name: v32
body:
*Fixes*
- [Improve error messages in delete_vm](https://github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/commit/550e927172ede980a2ea137ed54efa8d28c584ee)
- [Actually delete registry settings on VM deletion](https://github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/commit/715272c2aa75b3b9f212fee282b9524816d7a829)

*New features*
- [Load Balancer as a Service](http://bosh.io/docs/openstack-cpi.html#resource-pools)
  - Example of load balancing in bosh-init manifest
``` yaml
resource_pools:
- name: default
  network: default
  stemcell:
    name: bosh-openstack-kvm-ubuntu-trusty-go_agent
    version: latest
  cloud_properties:
    loadbalancer_pools:
      - name: lbaas_pool_1
        port: 8081
```

name: v31
body:
Now tested on OpenStack Newton!

_Fixes_
- [Light stemcell deletion fails when image is deleted from glance](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135325901)
- [Stemcell upload fails on slow environments](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/138140171)
- [Floating IP assignment on Huawei FusionSphere](#62) via #63 (thanks @shoudusse and @gberche-orange!)  

_New Features_
- [Introduce new API method `calculate_vm_cloud_properties`](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/126023557) via #56 (thanks @ljfranklin and @cdutra!) 
- [Introduce new API method `info`](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136637003) via #64 (thanks @barthy1 and @knm3000!)
- [Introduce multi-cpi support](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/134693605) via #52 (thanks @MatthiasWinzeler!)
- [Redact `user_data` in logs of `create_vm`](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135200707)
- [Add instance metadata to disks](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/107495224) – Disks now have `instance_name`, `instance_uuid`, and `index` as metadata, so you can tell from Horizon/OpenStack CLI where they belong to. Especially useful for orphaned disks!

_Misc_
- [Update ruby to 2.4.0](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/127806189)
- [Update rubygems to 2.6.8](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/127806189)
- [Update bundler to 1.13.7](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/127806189)
- [Update libyaml to 0.1.7](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/127806189)
- [Update fog-openstack to 0.1.19](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135855039)

name: v30
body:
_New Features_
- [Add `openstack.default_volume_type`](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135146373) to set the default volume type for all persistent disks created by the CPI. Via PR #55, thanks @ljfranklin and @cdutra!

name: v29
body:
_Fixes_
- [   Don't return empty string as valid az for volumes](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135269529). Fixes #54

name: v28
body:
By default, OpenStack CPI now runs with **neutron** instead of **nova-networking**. If you require nova-networking, switch on `openstack.use_nova_networking: true` to turn on compatibility mode in the CPI. Be aware that future OpenStack versions will remove this API at some point. See [documentation on bosh.io](http://bosh.io/docs/openstack-nova-networking.html) for additional information.

Fixes:
- Remove [deprecated nova calls](http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/newton.html#deprecation-notes) and use corresponding OpenStack services instead: [glance](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/131973293), [cinder](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/131973341), [neutron](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/131426399)

New Features:
- CPI support for light stemcells ([1](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/132897009), [2](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/132903395), [3](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/132903517))
- Added [script to create light stemcells](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/132896451) for already uploaded images
- [Redact OpenStack passwords and auth tokens in the debug log](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/115247357)

name: v27
body:
Fixes:
- [Display correct error message when running on nova-networking and VM creation fails](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/128759741)
  - Previously you saw `ERROR -- : OpenStack API service not found error: Could not find service network.  Have compute, compute_legacy, identity, image, volume, volumev2`, which was hiding the original error

name: v26
body:
OpenStack CPI now tested on OpenStack Mitaka!

Fixes:
- [Quote proxy environment variables so specifying a list of `no_proxy` hosts actually works](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/128129759)
- [`boot_from_volume: true` now works with OpenStack Mitaka](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/127710961)

New features:
- support for glance v2 (https://github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/49 thanks @ljfranklin and @cunnie!) 
- support for cinder v2 (https://github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/49 thanks @ljfranklin and @cunnie!)
- stemcells now have human-readable names instead of UUIDs! (`bosh-openstack-kvm-ubuntu-trusty-go_agent/3262.5` instead of `BOSH-UUID`)
- [more detailed debug log output when creating VMs in multiple networks](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/117241945)

Misc:
- bumped to fog-openstack 0.1.7

name: v25
body:
Fixes:
- [`avoid having extra bash process while running cpi`](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/119609491) (https://github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/37 thanks @friegger and @cheeseblubber)

New Features:
- [Define root disk size in deployment manifest](http://bosh.io/docs/openstack-cpi.html#resource-pools) (https://github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/35 thanks @kanekoh and @dkoper)
  - Example of an `m1.small` instance with custom root disk size of 50GB:

``` yaml
resource_pools:
- name: default
  network: default
  stemcell:
    name: bosh-openstack-kvm-ubuntu-trusty-go_agent
    version: latest
  cloud_properties:
    instance_type: m1.small
    availability_zone: east
    root_disk:
      size: 50
```

Misc:
- Switch to `block_device_mapping_v2` for `boot_from_volume: true` (https://github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/33 thanks @dkoper and @kanekoh) 
- Bumped to fog-openstack 0.1.6 
  - [changes endpoint for `boot_from_volume: true` to `/servers`](https://github.com/fog/fog-openstack/pull/87)
  - removes dependency to fog-xml and nokogiri. Faster installations, yay!
- Get rid of development dependencies in distributed release. (https://github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/32 thanks @coreyti, @ljfranklin, and @friegger)
- Release size down to ~16MB from ~31MB

name: v24
body:
- [Support for multiple manual networks](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/114099831)
  - [View documentation for usage and limitations](http://bosh.io/docs/openstack-multiple-networks.html)
- [Use VM names provided by BOSH](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/116691769)
  - When using `human_readable_vm_names: true`, VM names now use instance ids instead of index if the Director provides them
- [Remove `ca_cert` content from excon debug logs](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/113922541)

name: v23
body:
- [Human-readable VM names](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/epic/show/2291339) - 
  The CPI can set more meaningful names for VMs now! Instead of UUIDs such as `vm-4971ee11-f956-406f-9220-8e1ee1a1873c` you get names such as `runner_z1/0`
  - set [`openstack.human_readable_vm_names: true`](http://bosh.io/jobs/openstack_cpi?source=github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release&version=23#p=openstack.human_readable_vm_names)
  - configure your registry with the [`registry.endpoint`](http://bosh.io/docs/openstack-registry.html) property to include basic auth credentials
  - Existing VMs will not be touched, continue to work, and still have their UUID-based name
- [Custom RootCA support for OpenStack Endpoints](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/epic/show/2291377) - If you previously set [`openstack.connection_options.ssl_validate_peer: false`](http://bosh.io/jobs/openstack_cpi?source=github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release&version=23#p=openstack.connection_options), you can now provide your custom RootCA certificate instead!
  - Set [`openstack.connection_options.ca_cert`](http://bosh.io/jobs/openstack_cpi?source=github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release&version=23#p=openstack.connection_options) to the necessary certificate(s)
  - configure your registry with the [`registry.endpoint`](http://bosh.io/docs/openstack-registry.html) property to include basic auth credentials

name: v21
body:
- [Support for Bosh blobstore in AWS S3 regions China and Frankfurt](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/n/projects/1456570/stories/112191939) (which require version 4 signing), thanks @flawedmatrix 
  - Added new manifest properties `blobstore.s3_region` and `blobstore.s3_signature_version`

name: v20 – DO NOT USE
body: Due to a bug in our continuous integration pipeline this release is broken. DO NOT USE.

name: v19 – DO NOT USE
body: Due to defaults set in the CPI deployment manifest, this release might break compatibility with older stemcells, if you use an external blobstore for your Director. DO NOT USE.

name: v18
body:
- [bump httpclient to 2.7.1](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/111907325), thanks @coreyti and @ljfranklin!
- Improved error messages
  -  [when OpenStack cannot be reached](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/98986604)
  -  [when VM creation call doesn't return quickly enough](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/107730854)

name: v17
body:
- [Support PowerPC](https://github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/pull/17), thanks @hashmap!
- [Improve `Entity Too Large` error message](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/100582600)
- Make [test pipeline setup](https://github.com/cloudfoundry-incubator/bosh-openstack-cpi-release/blob/master/docs/running_tests.md) easier to have it run against your own OpenStack installation

name: v16
body:
- [Renamed job `cpi` to `openstack_cpi`](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/105868858)
  - **Note:** This breaks current bosh-init deployment manifests! Be sure to change `director.cpi_job`, `cloud_provider.template`, and `templates` properties to specify `openstack_cpi`.
- [User can specify security groups on `resource_pool`](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/104956254)
  - You can still use existing manifests which specify security_groups on the network. [See docs](https://bosh.io/docs/openstack-cpi.html#resource-pools).
  - Note: After implementing this feature we have removed configure_networks CPI implementation which means that changing floating IP for a VM will actually recreate that VM

name: v15
body:
- [Keystone v3 support](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/104344480)
  - Adds `openstack.domain` and `openstack.project` properties

name: v14
body: - [Backfill missing blobstore options for S3](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/104580916)

name: v13
body: - [Switched to using Ruby 2.0](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/103636340)
